artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Akiyama Buemon
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 457; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 127, p. 291.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; man at center in foreground, kneeling on straw mat, with head thrown back and mouth open, holding up his PL arm; man wears white and blue blouse and purple pants with white medallions; woman and man kneeling with hands folded at right; woman wears purple floral kimono; man wears olive green kimono with white medallions and tall black cap; figures at top in flame-like vision, including large man at center with long black hair and beard, with open mouth, wearing light blue kimono with hat with blue and red round elements, woman's head on a gold and black stand, two demons--one with blue skin and white hair and one with brown hair and horns, man with paper at left and man with black moustache at right
dimension: 14 3/4 × 10 in. (37.47 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 大蘇 {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 芝サクラ川山本刀 {Shiba Sakuragawa Yamamoto tō} | Printer’s seal: 摺常 {suri Tsune}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Picture of the Fever of Taira no Kiyomori
